awd_titl_txt: A Dynamic Angle Spinning NMR Probe for 27 A1 NMR            Characterization of Silica-Alumina Catalysts
awd_abstract_narration: A dynamic-angle spinning probe for solid-state nuclear                          magnetic resonance is acquired tosupport research in                            engineering.  The initial use of the probe will be the                          characterization of amorphous silia-alumina acid catalysts.                     Model catalysts with the acid function restricted to the                        surface are prepared and the density and strength of acid                       sites aremeasured by a conbination of base adosrption andacid-                  catalyzed reactions.  The activity of tehsilica-aluminas is                     correlated with the structure determined by dunamic-angle                       aluninum-27 nuclear magnetic resonance.                                         Acid catalysts are widely used industrially.  Because of their                  low cost, applications can be expected to increase in fuels                     refinement, chemicals production, and environmental control.                    However, a better understanding of their behavior is necessary                  to design control systems for optimum conversions.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
